VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Biomass relative to the peak of Tidal in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Biomass is to the {left} of the peak of Tidal.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Hybrid Systems} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =24.9?
EVJ.A: At X =24.9,the label with the highest density is {Geothermal}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 39? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NF.A: {Wind}'s peak at {42},{Hydroelectric}'s peak at {9},{Geothermal}'s peak at {13},{Biomass}'s peak at {20},{Hybrid Systems}'s peak at {11}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Geothermal or Biomass?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Tidal or Hybrid Systems?
NC.A: {Tidal} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Biomass or Wind?
NC.A: {Wind} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Hybrid Systems}
